title: Poster, Reflections on the Signing of the Declaration of Independence, ca. 1976
title_raw: Reflections on the Signing of the Declaration of Independence
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
inscribed:
Imprinted in black lower center:  Reflections on the Signing of the Declaration of Independence, Philadelphia 1776 / Done on the occassion of the Bicentennial of the American Revolution for Independence    National Historical Park, Philadelphia. National Park Service, U.S. Department of the Interior 
Imprinted in black upper left on edge: For sale by the Superintendent of Documents, U.S. Government Printing Office, Washington, DC 20402. Stock Number 024-005-00605-2 [star] GPO: 1976-211-318/1
description: On a white background, in the upper half of the sheet an illegible scrawled signature in black above a blue handled nib pen below with the name STEINBERG on the handle. Centered in the lower section of the sheet, two leaves of a folio are reproduced. On the left a greening sheet of paper with cream along left side, and on the right a facsimilie of a ledger sheet. Both sheets are marked with what appears to be a late 18th century hand although the writing itself is illegible. Both sheets bear stamps; blue ship at left and a t right a red ship. Below title: Reflections on the Signing of the Declaration of Independence, Philadelphia 1776, and inscription.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, Reflections on the Signing of the Declaration of Independence, ca. 1976. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. 
Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-248
